page.title: 10Stansted Estate
page.content: The Stansted Estate is a large area of woodlands mainly of Sweet Chesnut, Beech,Oak and Conifers which are grown as timber for the sawmill. Running through the forest is a Beech avenue.{The avenue is two miles}long which is the longest in England and it leads from Stansted House to Rowlands Castle. Near the estate House is St Pauls Chapel.The Chapel is rather unusual in that although it is a{Christian Church it has a lot of{judaic symbols}in the glass windows. This is because Mr Lewis Way wanted to convert Jews into Christians. There is a small triangle of woods to the south of the estate,the custom is that local people can take bean poles and pea sticks from there. There are a number of farms which have been sold off by the estate.{
